result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond H. Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raymond H. Chapman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raymond H. Chapman was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment - and Mental and Health Assessment.
**  Pay fine of $300.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.
Pay restitution plus surcharges.  
** Pay extradition costs. May Not have contact with Maria Chapman, her residence or place of employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond H. Chapman

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  Matter heard with 14CF1110.  State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions.  Court orders $300.00 fine plus & DNA surcharge.  DE stipulates to restitution & extradition costs.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $1,928.59 & extradition costs in the amount of $1,852.00.  Appeal rights given.
For Restitution order - filed by ADA J Zapf.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  4:05pm-  Matter heard with 15CF706 & 14CF1110.  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Hilary Edwards.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7.  Information filed; plea of not guilty entered.  FPT 9/30/15 at 2:30.  Bond continued.

131 p.m.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clk  NJurgens.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Bond - continued.
Filed by Atty H Edwards.
Atty:  H Edwards.

221 p.m.  Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney James Fields-Bowars. Clk  NJurgens.  Initial appearance adjourned to 8/4/15 @ 1:00pm w/Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  $2500 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  Adjourned so Atty Edwards may appear, time limits tolled for cause.    Defendant is on a PO Hold.

*No Contact w/ Mary & Harry C or their residence.
